questions.question: How do I search for people given their current title, current company and location?
questions.answer: Use the /screener/person/search API endpoint. Example: curl --location 'https://api.crustdata.com/screener/person/search'...

questions.question: Is there a standard you're using for the region values?
questions.answer: Yes, refer to https://crustdata-docs-region-json.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/updated_regions.json.

questions.question: How do I authenticate API requests?
questions.answer: You can authenticate API requests by including an 'Authorization' header with a Bearer token. Example: 'Authorization: Bearer <your_token>'.

questions.question: What data formats are supported for API requests?
questions.answer: Our APIs support JSON format for requests and responses. Ensure your Content-Type header is set to 'application/json'.

questions.question: Can I paginate results from the search API?
questions.answer: Yes, use the 'page' parameter in your API call to paginate results. Example: 'page=1' for the first page, 'page=2' for the next.

questions.question: How do I retrieve data for multiple people using their email addresses?
questions.answer: Use the /screener/person/search API with the 'filters' parameter set to 'EMAIL'. Example: { 'filters': [{ 'filter_type': 'EMAIL', 'value': ['email1@example.com', 'email2@example.com'] }] }.

questions.question: What are the rate limits for API usage?
questions.answer: Our APIs support up to 1000 requests per minute. If you exceed this limit, you will receive a 429 Too Many Requests error.

questions.question: What should I do if I get a 400 Bad Request error?
questions.answer: A 400 error indicates invalid input. Check your API payload and ensure all required fields are provided and properly formatted.

questions.question: How do I use filters for job titles?
questions.answer: Use the 'CURRENT_TITLE' filter in the API payload. Example: { 'filters': [{ 'filter_type': 'CURRENT_TITLE', 'type': 'in', 'value': ['Engineer', 'Manager'] }] }.

questions.question: Can I search for people by their skills?
questions.answer: Currently, searching by skills is not supported. However, you can use job titles or company names as filters for more precise results.

questions.question: How do I handle errors in API responses?
questions.answer: Check the 'error' field in the API response JSON. It will contain the error type and message. Example: { 'error': 'Invalid token' }.

questions.question: How do I update my API token?
questions.answer: Log in to your Crustdata account dashboard, navigate to API settings, and regenerate your token. Replace the old token in your API calls.

questions.question: Is the API compatible with Python requests library?
questions.answer: Yes, you can use the Python requests library to make API calls. Example: 'requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=payload)'.

questions.question: Can I sort search results?
questions.answer: Yes, use the 'sort' parameter in the payload. Example: { 'sort': { 'field': 'name', 'order': 'asc' } } to sort by name in ascending order.

questions.question: What happens if I pass an empty filter to the search API?
questions.answer: If you pass an empty filter, the API will return all available data for the endpoint, which may result in a large response.

questions.question: How do I check the status of my API key?
questions.answer: You can check the status of your API key in the Crustdata dashboard under 'API Key Management'.

questions.question: What is the response format for a successful API call?
questions.answer: A successful API call returns a JSON object containing the requested data, along with metadata like 'status', 'total_records', and 'page'.

questions.question: Can I filter results by industry?
questions.answer: Yes, use the 'CURRENT_INDUSTRY' filter in your payload. Example: { 'filters': [{ 'filter_type': 'CURRENT_INDUSTRY', 'value': ['Technology', 'Healthcare'] }] }.

questions.question: How do I report a bug in the API?
questions.answer: You can report bugs via the Crustdata support portal or email us at support@crustdata.com with a detailed description of the issue.

questions.question: Can I use the API for bulk data extraction?
questions.answer: Bulk data extraction requires additional permissions. Contact support@crustdata.com for approval and documentation.
